item.title: 加拿大油砂联盟征集碳捕集管道提案
item.description: 加拿大油砂生产商集团在建设一个价值 160 亿加元的碳捕集与封存网络方面迈出了第一步，该网络将有助于减少该行业的碳排放量。【原文：A group of Canadian oil sands producers took an initial step in constructing a C$16 billion carbon capture and storage network that would help slash the industries carbon emissions.】

item.title: 拜登将在大选后跳过 COP29 气候峰会
item.description: 乔-拜登总统将不会出席在美国大选后几天开幕的联合国气候变化峰会，这次峰会将决定美国未来几年在气候变化问题上的态度。【原文：President Joe Biden will not attend a major UN climate change summit opening just days after the US election and set to shape the country’s approach to the issue for years to come.】

item.title: 多米尼克公司与更多科技公司就下一代核能技术进行谈判
item.description: 多米尼昂能源公司正积极与包括技术公司在内的潜在合作伙伴商讨开发小型模块化核反应堆的协议；这与该公司上个月与亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc.【原文：Dominion Energy Inc. is actively involved in discussions with potential partners, including technology firms, on agreements to develop small modular nuclear reactors — similar to the deal it signed with Amazon.com Inc. last month.】

item.title: 美国顶级电力监管机构将数据中心视为重要机遇
item.description: 联邦最高能源监管机构表示，支持数据中心的发展，包括提供其所需的大量电力，事关国家安全。【原文：Supporting the development of data centers — including providing the enormous amounts of electricity they require — is a matter of national security, a top federal energy regulator said.】

item.title: 南非汽车出口因欧盟更严格的排放规定而骤降
item.description: 南非的汽车出口量几乎减少了一半，部分原因是欧洲更严格的排放规定导致需求放缓，以及来自中国的廉价电动汽车的竞争。【原文：South African car exports almost halved, partly due to a slowdown in demand in Europe because of stricter emission rules and competition from cheaper electric vehicles from China.】

item.title: 西班牙士兵搜寻失踪人员，死亡人数上升
item.description: 西班牙救援队正在洪水肆虐的派波尔塔市搜寻数十名失踪人员，本周暴风雨造成的死亡人数已上升到至少 158 人。【原文：Spanish rescue teams are searching for dozens of missing people in the flood-ravaged city of Paiporta, as the death toll from this week’s storms rose to at least 158.】

item.title: 英国石油公司大托尔图天然气项目是毛里塔尼亚的 "重要组成部分" 能源
item.description: 毛里塔尼亚将优先使用英国石油公司（BP Plc）大托尔图-阿赫迈耶姆（Greater Tortue Ahmeyim）开发项目的天然气，因为毛里塔尼亚希望在增加可再生能源的同时提高电力供应。【原文：Mauritania will prioritize using gas from BP Plc’s Greater Tortue Ahmeyim development as it looks to increase access to electricity while it adds more renewable energy.】

item.title: 奇货可居：核能复兴对铀意味着什么（播客）
item.description: 有一种对铀的崇拜：投资者和交易商相信核能是能源的未来，因此这种重要的商品最终会成为大赢家。在过去几年里，铀的价格大幅上涨。但铀市场的经济效益如何？它对一些正在重开的发电厂有多敏感？在本期节目中，我们将与伯恩斯坦公司美洲能源与转型部门主管、大宗商品专家鲍勃-布拉克特（Bob Brackett）进行对话。【原文：There’s something of a uranium cult out there: the investors and traders who believe that nuclear is the future of energy, and therefore this crucial commodity will end up being a huge winner. And over the last several years, the price has gone up substantially. But what are the economics of the uranium market? And how sensitive is it to some of these power plants that are reopening? On this episode, we speak with commodities guru Bob Brackett, head of Americas energy and transition at Bernstein】

item.title: 西班牙部署 1,700 名士兵协助致命风暴救灾工作

item.title: 特朗普承诺在气候问题上调转方向引发绕过他的行动

item.title: 如果特朗普获胜，气候外交官准备绕过美国的角色

item.title: 围绕 "气候避风港 "的模糊信息
item.description:

item.title: 电动汽车需求减弱，福特将停止 F-150 闪电的生产
item.description: 由于电动汽车的需求持续减弱，福特汽车公司计划在今年年底前关闭生产其标志性电动汽车 F-150 Lightning 插电式皮卡的密歇根工厂。【原文：Ford Motor Co. plans to shut down the Michigan factory that produces its F-150 Lightning plug-in pickup truck, its signature electric vehicle, through the end of the year as demand for EVs continues to wane.】

item.title: 火灾和洪水使气候成为巴西人的主要担忧

item.title: 印度德里为何是世界上空气污染最严重的城市之一？
item.description: 数亿印度人常年呼吸着世界上最有毒的空气。拥有约 3000 万人口的首都地区的空气污染尤为严重。在冬季，寒冷的天气实际上使烟雾更加严重和强烈。新德里的一项污染指标经常超过世界卫生组织建议的每日限值 20 倍以上。研究表明，印度的污浊空气每年导致约 100 万人或更多人死亡，这是一个巨大的数字。【原文：Hundreds of millions of Indians breathe some of the world’s most toxic air year round. Air pollution in the capital area that’s home to about 30 million people is especially stubborn. In winter, the cold weather actually makes the smog even worse — and potent. One measure of pollution in New Delhi frequently exceeds the World Health Organization’s daily recommended limits by a factor of more than 20. Studies show India’s dirty air has been killing about a million or more people a year, a massive】

item.description: 南非承诺减少其燃煤发电厂的排放量，以争取获得 26 亿美元的气候融资。尽管南非试图改变 2022 年协议的条款，推迟彻底关闭其中三座设施。【原文：South Africa pledged to slash emissions across its fleet of coal-fired power plants in a bid to secure $2.6 billion in climate finance.
